action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A horse is grazing in a grassy field with mountains and trees in the background.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A brown and white horse grazing on a grassy hillside with a mountain range in the background.

This is my DESCRIPTION: A horse is grazing in a grassy field with mountains and trees in the background.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the horse brown and white or a solid color?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A brown and white horse grazing on a grassy hillside with a mountain range in the background.
QUESTION: Is the horse brown and white or a solid color? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any trees in the background of your image?

ANSWER: Brown and white
QUESTION: Are there any trees in the background of your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: How many mountains can you see in the background of your image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: How many mountains can you see in the background of your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is the horse standing still while grazing?

ANSWER: 1
QUESTION: Is the horse standing still while grazing? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: What color is the sky in your image?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: What color is the sky in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any rocks visible in the foreground of your image?

ANSWER: Blue
QUESTION: Are there any rocks visible in the foreground of your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.

ANSWER: No
